reference.title: New Activity Based on Template wizard
reference.shortdesc: Creates a new Android activity based upon a sample you have chosen.

section.p: When adding a new activity to your Android project, MOTODEV Studio enables you to quickly and easily add either a basic (mostly empty) activity, or one based upon a sample. MOTODEV Studio includes a number of sample activities that, with minor modifications, can be incorporated into your applications and will perform various functions commonly needed by many Android applications.

To create a basic, empty activity you select NewAndroid Activity from the File menu. If you want to base your activity on one of the supplied sample activities, either select NewAndroid Activity from the File menu and then click Create New Activity Based On Template from the dialog that appears, or select Auto-generated codeCreate Activity based on template from the MOTODEV menu. Either method invokes the New Android Activity Based on Template wizard.

The New Android Activity Based on Template wizard begins by having you select the sample activity on which your project's new activity is to be based. (Note that one of the samples--Database List--lists the contents of selected columns within your application's SQLite database; in order to select this sample your application must already have a database in its assets folder.) Select the template activity, and click Next. You will then be presented with a dialog containing a number of fields with which you specify various aspects of the activity to be created.

strow.stentry: The folder into which the source code for the new activity is to be stored. By default this is the current project's src folder.
The package that is to contain the new activity. By default this is the current project's package.
The name to be used for the class that implements the activity. This should be a simple, non-qualified name.

(optional) The label for the activity. This label is displayed to the user, often along with the activity's icon, when the activity needs to be identified to the user. Note that if you specify a label, the wizard creates a string resource to hold this value. If the Default option is selected, a label is not set for this activity (the Label field is not editable); the user sees the application's label instead.
The class from which the activity inherits. For activities, this is android.app.Activity.
(optional) Permissions that should be added to the project's manifest file due to this activity. Click Add to display a list of possible permissions from which you can select.

(optional) The actions to be performed by an intent filter associated with this activity. Click Add to select from the available actions, or Input to simply enter the full name of the intent filter. Note that you can select multiple intents from the dialog that appears when you click Add. To select a range, select the first item in the set and then hold down the Shift key while selecting the last item in the set. To select multiple separate intents, select the first item and then hold down the Control key while selecting the remaining items.
(optional) The associated intent filter categories. Click Add to select from the available categories or click Input to enter a category manually.

Select this option if this new activity is to be the app's main activity. Doing so updates the application's manifest file to specify that this is the activity that should be started when the application is first launched.
